[SEC] 1. Introduction.[SUBSEC] 1.1 Purpose: The Number Portability Administration Center (NPAC) SMS defines requirements for number portability management, ensuring seamless provisioning, synchronization, and fault recovery.
[SEC] 1. Introduction.[SUBSEC] 1.2 Scope: NPAC supports number portability operations, transaction processing, and compliance with telecommunication standards.

[SUBSEC] 1.3 Product Perspective.[SUBSUBSEC] 1.3.1 System Interfaces: NPAC integrates with SOA, LSMS, and authentication for real-time sync.
[SUBSEC] 1.3 Product Perspective.[SUBSUBSEC] 1.3.2 User Interfaces: NPAC provides web-based portals and APIs for administration and monitoring.
[SUBSEC] 1.3 Product Perspective.[SUBSUBSEC] 1.3.3 Hardware Interfaces: NPAC operates on distributed servers with high availability architecture.
[SUBSEC] 1.3 Product Perspective.[SUBSUBSEC] 1.3.4 Software Interfaces: NPAC supports modern OS and databases.
[SUBSEC] 1.3 Product Perspective.[SUBSUBSEC] 1.3.5 Communications Interfa: NPAC secures data exchange using TLS encryption.
[SUBSEC] 1.3 Product Perspective.[SUBSUBSEC] 1.3.6 Memory Constraints: NPAC optimizes resource allocation for high transaction throughput.
[SUBSEC] 1.3 Product Perspective.[SUBSUBSEC] 1.3.7 Operations: NPAC ensures 24/7 availability with automated monitoring and maintenance.
[SUBSEC] 1.3 Product Perspective.[SUBSUBSEC] 1.3.8 Site Adaptation Requir: NPAC is configurable for deployment across multiple regions.
[SUBSEC] 1.3 Product Perspective.[SUBSUBSEC] 1.3.9 Interfaces with Servic: NPAC connects with third-party platforms for extended functionalities.

[SEC] 1. Introduction.[SUBSEC] 1.4 Product Functions: NPAC manages portability workflows, provisioning, and recovery mechanisms for operational stability.
[SEC] 1. Introduction.[SUBSEC] 1.5 User Characteristics: Designed for telecom operators, regulatory bodies, and administrators with basic to advanced system knowledge.
[SEC] 1. Introduction.[SUBSEC] 1.6 Limitations: NPAC depends on stable external systems and compliance.
[SEC] 1. Introduction.[SUBSEC] 1.7 Assumptions and Dependencie: NPAC requires adherence to industry protocols, secure data handling, and operational system availability.
[SUBSEC] 1.8 Definitions: Number Portability: Retaining a phone number when switching providers.

[SUBSEC] 2.1 External Interfaces.REQ-INTF-001: The system shall integrate with SOA and LSMS for data synchronization.
[SUBSEC] 2.1 External Interfaces.REQ-INTF-002: The system shall provide APIs for real-time updates and communication with external systems.

[SUBSEC] 2.2 Functions.REQ-FUNC-001: The system shall manage number portability operations efficiently, ensuring minimal downtime (REQ-INTF-001, REQ-DB-001).

[SUBSEC] 2.3 Usability Requirements.REQ-USAB-001: The system shall provide intuitive interfaces for managing administrative tasks.

[SUBSEC] 2.4 Performance Requirements.REQ-PERF-001: The system shall process up to 1000 transactions per second with an average latency of under 50 milliseconds (REQ-DSGN-001).

[SUBSEC] 2.5 Logical Database Requiremen.REQ-DB-001: The database shall ensure ACID compliance for transaction reliability.
[SUBSEC] 2.5 Logical Database Requiremen.REQ-DB-002: The database shall support efficient backup and restoration operations.

[SUBSEC] 2.6 Design Constraints.REQ-DSGN-001: The system shall comply with telecommunication industry standards to ensure interoperability.
[SUBSEC] 2.6 Design Constraints.REQ-DSGN-002: The system architecture shall support modular extensions for scalability.

[SUBSEC] 2.7 Standards Compliance.REQ-COMP-001: The system shall adhere to GDPR guidelines for secure data handling.
[SUBSEC] 2.7 Standards Compliance.REQ-COMP-002: The system shall comply with ISO/IEC standards for information security.

[SUBSEC] 2.8 Software System Attributes.REQ-ATTR-001: The system shall scale dynamically to handle increasing data loads.
[SUBSEC] 2.8 Software System Attributes.REQ-ATTR-002: The system shall log critical events for monitoring and debugging.

[SEC] 3. Verification: Functional testing, performance benchmarking, and compliance validation will ensure system reliability.
[SEC] 4. Supporting Information: User manuals, configuration guides, and troubleshooting resources for operational support.
